snippet: Everyone agrees that Proposition 209, which will be on California's ballot in November, could mean significant changes for affirmative action programs. But voters would not have known that by reading the ballot initiative summary prepared by Attor...
lead_paragraph: Everyone agrees that Proposition 209, which will be on California's ballot in November, could mean significant changes for affirmative action programs. But voters would not have known that by reading the ballot initiative summary prepared by Attorney General Dan Lungren, a judge said on Thursday. The judge ordered Mr. Lungren to rewrite the ballot summary of Proposition 209 to say that its chief purpose is to change affirmative action programs.
abstract: Judge James Ford orders California Atty Gen Dan Lungren to rewrite ballot summary of Proposition 209 to say that its chief purpose is to change affirmative action programs; holds Lungren's current summary is too vague because it does not contain words 'affirmative action' (S)

headline.main: Affirmative-Action Ballot Too Vague, Judge Says
